div: In order to save the alterations you made to a spectrum file that occurred during calibration, navigate to the Interspec → Save As; this will save the entire InterSpec state (includes current spectra) to the database under your specified name/description which you can restore back to at a later time. To save any changes in the future, select InterSpec → Save which will overwrite the save data. This is known as the HEAD, and will always contain the latest changes.
To save a bookmark (also known as tag) of the current state, select InterSpec → Tag. Tags can not be overwritten. Think of them as an archived state.
To open either the entire application state or individual spectra, navigate to Interspec → Load or Interspec → Manager → Saved Snapshots.
To change whether InterSpec will automatically save application state, nagivate to Help → Options → Automatically save snapshots.
